uk.ac.macaulay.util
Class FileFormatException

java.lang.Object
  java.lang.Throwable
      java.lang.Exception
          java.io.IOException
              uk.ac.macaulay.util.FileFormatException
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
public class FileFormatException
extends java.io.IOException

An exception caused when a file does not conform to an expected format.

Author:
Gary Polhill
See Also:

Constant Field Values
Constructor Detail

FileFormatException

public FileFormatException(java.lang.String filename,
                           java.lang.String format,
                           java.lang.String expecting,
                           java.lang.String found)
Basic constructor

Parameters:
filename - The name of the file that does not conform to format
format - The format it is expected to conform to
expecting - What was expected to be found (no quotes put round this in the message to allow for generic descriptions)
found - What was actually found (this will be put in quotes in the message, unless null, in which case end of file is assumed)

FileFormatException

public FileFormatException(java.lang.String filename,
                           java.lang.String format,
                           java.lang.String expecting,
                           java.lang.String found,
                           int line)
Constructor when line number is known

Parameters:
filename - The name of the file that does not conform to format
format - The format it is expected to conform to
expecting - What was expected to be found (no quotes put round this in the message to allow for generic descriptions)
found - What was actually found (this will be put in quotes in the message, unless null, in which case end of file is assumed)
line - The line number where the problem occurred.

FileFormatException

public FileFormatException(java.lang.String filename,
                           java.lang.String format,
                           java.lang.String expecting,
                           java.lang.String found,
                           int line,
                           int ch)
Constructor when accurate file position is known

Parameters:
filename - The name of the file that does not conform to format
format - The format it is expected to conform to
expecting - What was expected to be found (no quotes put round this in the message to allow for generic descriptions)
found - What was actually found (this will be put in quotes in the message, unless null, in which case end of file is assumed)
line - The line number where the problem occurred.
ch - The character number where the problem occurred.
